page.title: 19Talking to an octogenarian.
page.content: March 1985.Mr.O.Priestly came to Cockfield School to tell us of his life in our area.He told us that he was one of 15 children.He started school at 5 yrs and had to walk 3 mls. there and back.There was no school transport only farmers and rich people had horses and traps.His family walked every where.At the age of 14 he started work in a mine which was very dark and pit ponies were used to pull coal trucks.His pay was very low. Mr.Priestly remembered being caned at school when he was naughty and said that this punishment was to teach him to behave well. He remembers living in the war when food was in short supply and even clothes were rationed. Mr.Priestly told us of the hardship of his mothers wash day,and that he was quite a mature person before he ate 'bought'bread.He's seen many changes.
